DataElement.preferredName: Person Body Surface Area Method Text Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The words that describe the means by which a result is obtained for a measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The means by which a result is obtained for a measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface of an individual.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional exent of the body surface.:A way of doing something; how a result is obtained or an end is achieved.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
A way of doing something; how a result is obtained or an end is achieved.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Body Surface Area Method Text Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words that describe the means by which a result is obtained for a measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by E Boyd. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.0003207 x [Height(cm)^0.3] x [Weight(g)^(0.7285 - ( 0.0188 x LOG(g))]

Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by E Boyd. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.0003207 x [Height(cm)^0.3] x [Weight(g)^(0.7285 - (0.0188 x LOG(g))]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Dogs

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Dogs
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in dogs. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.0 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

Concepts.longName: Body Surface Area Formula for Dogs
Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area in dogs. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.0 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Dubois and Dubois Body Surface Area Formula

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Dubois and Dubois Body Surface Area Formula
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by D and EF DuBois. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.20247 x [Height(m)^0.725] x [Weight(kg)^0.425]

Concepts.longName: Dubois and Dubois Body Surface Area Formula
Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by D and EF DuBois. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.20247 x [Height(m)^0.725] x [Weight(kg)^0.425]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Cats

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Cats
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in cats. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.1 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

Concepts.longName: Body Surface Area Formula for Cats
Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area in cats. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.1 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gehan and George Body Surface Area Formula

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gehan and George Body Surface Area Formula
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by EA Gehan and SL George. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) =  0.0235 x Height(cm)^0.42246 x Weight(kg)^0.51456

Concepts.longName: Gehan and George Body Surface Area Formula
Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by EA Gehan and SL George. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.0235 x Height(cm)^0.42246 x Weight(kg)^0.51456

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
The formula to calculate body surface area as described by Haycock. It is mathematically defined as:  BSA (m^2) = 0.024265 x 
[Height(cm)^0.3964] x [Weight(kg)^0.5378]

Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by GB Haycock et al. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 0.024265 x [Height(cm)^0.3964] x [Weight(kg)^0.5378]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Linear Regression Body Surface Area Formula for Infants and Children

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Linear Regression Body Surface Area Formula for Infants and Children
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by John D. Current. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 1321 + 0.3433 x Weight(g)

Concepts.longName: Linear Regression Body Surface Area Formula for Infants and Children
Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by John D. Current. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = 1321 + 0.3433 x Weight(g)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by RD Mosteller. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = ([Height(cm) x Weight(kg)]/3600)^0.5; e.g. BSA = SQRT((cm x kg)/3600)

Concepts.definition: The formula to calculate body surface area as described by RD Mosteller. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = ([Height(cm) x Weight(kg)]/3600)^0.5; e.g. BSA = SQRT((cm x kg)/3600)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A graphical calculating device or a two-dimensional diagram designed to allow the approximate graphical computation of a function.

Concepts.definition: A graphical calculating device or a two-dimensional diagram designed to allow the approximate graphical computation of a function.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Rabbits

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Rabbits
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in rabbits. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (9.5 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Mice

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Mice
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in mice. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.5 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Rats

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Rats
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in rats. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (10.5 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Body Surface Area Formula for Guinea Pigs

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Body Surface Area Formula for Guinea Pigs
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The formula to calculate body surface area in guinea pigs. It is mathematically defined as: BSA (m^2) = (9.5 x Weight(g)^2/3)/1000

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional exent of the body surface.:A way of doing something; how a result is obtained or an end is achieved.:Text; the words of something written.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
A way of doing something; how a result is obtained or an end is achieved.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
